tutorial.speak:
The Plans section includes the ability to plan out your service order. When you create a new plan, you'll see a field to include Service Order. This enables the option to build an outline of your worship service, in addition to scheduling volunteers.
When you go to the plan details page, there will be a new tab for Service Order.
You can start building your service order by adding sections for the main breakdown of your service. For example, you may have a Welcome, Worship, Communion, Sermon, Closing Worship and Announcements. Click the plus icon to add each of these.
Now you can begin adding items to each section. Click the plus icon to add a new item. You can choose to add a song or manually add any other item.
Give the item a name and any notes you like, then enter the estimated duration.
When adding a song you will be given a search box.
Enter the song name and click search.
This will search only songs in your library. You will see a list of arrangments and keys available for each song. Choose the one you will use.
Add the song, and you will see the details in the plan.
Continue to add items to build out the order of service.
At any time you can change the order. Click the six dot icon to the left of any item and drag it to it's new position.
If you would like to print out copies of your order of service, click the print icon at the top.
This provides a nice overview sheet you can give to your volunteers.
Whenever your volunteers log into B1 to accept the serving request, the Order of Service information will also be there.
They can print out their own copies. They can also click on any song to see the details.
From this popup, they can view all the files they need to practice
along with links to listen to the song on YouTube, Spotify and other popular services.
